subject: Programming
title: Ken Thompson and Dennis Ritchie
description: A 60-second lesson on Ken Thompson and Dennis Ritchie.

hook.text: Two Bell Labs researchers built Unix and C in a forgotten corner of the office. Quietly, everything changed.

buildup.text: Thompson wrote the first Unix in three weeks. Ritchie created C to rewrite it portably.

discovery.text: Together, Unix and C gave the world a portable, powerful foundation for operating systems.

twist.text: AT&T gave Unix to universities cheaply. Students learned it, improved it, and carried it everywhere.

climax.text: Linux, macOS, Android, and most internet servers all descend from their quiet Bell Labs project.

punchline.text: Two colleagues quietly built computing's foundation.

quiz.question: What did Thompson and Ritchie create at Bell Labs?
options: Unix and the C programming language
